nope, like 95% same. maybe few resources and names are different, and api keys
it's like tablet and mobile version or something?

nope nope, rebranding for western market

simultaneously

text: that’s how i deal

releasing another version of Android
only after a year

whatever they put in the update is whats relevant not the version

fragmented af, with bits and pieces not working together
cause frankly ive never been happier.. finally things work and the support libraries let me skip the endless boiler plate nonsense of yesteryear
what support libraries are you using?
haha 23
I can’t sit in Android studio for more than 45 minutes it seems like without running into something that is at least partially broken
i guess i don’t care what framework comes out with as long as support lib keeps up
yeah im having the opposite.. all my tools finally work right like AS, the libs, my devices
for the most part
wow
nothing overly ‘god damnit google’ right now
im really surprised to hear that

(not including gradle in that part because they can still go to hell for that)

ahh well i never use debugging

you… don’t debug?
that’s very strange, check your usb cable or PC
like debug launch with break points? No
i dont
he doesn't write bugs
/giphy yeaaaaah
its a waste of time, write unit tests

(i switched a little before 1.0)

if i wrote unit tests i’d probably be using debug for those instead of my app :stuck_out_tongue:
anyways, back on point <@U0A0S0WG0> it sounds like your complaints are with the tooling team which to be frank I support you there

android studio is seemingly developed by the input of jake wharton and some other select devs

some of the new tools are boss

a lot more than normal
and so you get fragmentation across not only devices but across api’s on the same device

so i feel your pain
but first need to dismantle it into pieces
its really hard, if not impossible to write unit tests for OpenGL shit

like wtf

halts them 30-70% of the time depending on the day
a fragmented market should be solved by getting updates to people quicker, not slowing down development :stuck_out_tongue:

a problem not easily solved but yeah

that got pushed out by Qualcomm in january
and the updates still aren’t in consumer phones yet
and im talking shit that completely breaks our technology
